page.title: 02HOUSING IN THE CROOK AREA
page.content: APART FROM THE FEW FARMS WITH TIED COTTAGES ,MOST OF THE HOUSES ARE OWNER OCCUPIED,AND VARY FROM MODERNISED COTTAGES AND CONVERTED BARNS TO NEW HOUSES AND BUNGALOWS,A LARGE PROPORTION OF WHICH ARE HOLIDAY COTTAGES.THE ARCHITECTURE IS VARIED, MOSTLY TWO STORIES,WITH GARDENS AND USUALLY A GARAGE.THE OLD STONE-BUILT COTTAGES ARE SOMETIMES PLASTERED AND COLOURED.THE SUN INN HAS EXPANDED, USING THE FOUR ADJOINING COTTAGES.THE VILLAGE SCHOOL,CLOSED IN 1984,IS AWAITING PLANNING PERMISSION FOR CONVERSION INTO A DWELLING. MANY OF THE NEWER PROPERTIES HAVE OIL OR ELECTRIC CENTRAL HEATING.MAINS WATER REACHES ALMOST ALL,BUT SEWAGE DISPOSAL REMAINS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE HOUSEHOLDER IN SOME ISOLATED AREAS.
